posts.name: Parampreet Singh
posts.cooked:
Dear @s.anand sir,

I got QUIZ ID: Beijing:500.

I found several ambiguities while submitting answers.

Q3. What are the 3 most popular license among these users? Ignore missing licenses. List the license_name in order, comma-separated.

In Q3, based on my scraped data, I got:

NaN
mit
apache-2.0
others
gpl-3.0

as top 5 most popular license.
As it’s written in the question Ignore missing licenses, so I am left with mit,apache-2.0,others combination.

But, if I am submitting this, it’s showing incorrect and null,mit,apache-2.0 are being considered correct.

image752×182 16.6 KB

Q6. Which programming language is the second most popular among users who joined after 2020?

It is asking for second most popular language, but it’s accepting the first popular language.

I am getting following as output for languages with their count (popularity) for users who joined after 2020:

language
Python              10
NaN                  9
HTML                 6
TypeScript           5
C++                  3
JavaScript           3
Jupyter Notebook     3
Astro                2
Vue                  2
C#                   2
Name: count, dtype: int64

It should accept HTML, but it’s accepting Python.

image739×182 13.4 KB

Q12. Do hireable users follow more people than those who are not hireable?

For Q12 as well as Q15, it’s not accepting the numeric value, marking it as incorrect (I’ve tried several ways, got same value again and again), it is marking NaN as correct.

image739×182 21.3 KB

image739×182 20.2 KB

Regarding these 2 questions, there might be some issue in my users.csv, but I am not sure of, because I am getting number as a result while executing Python code. Please clarify this.

Please clarify these issues sir.

Also, If any other student has got same Quiz ID: Beijing:500, please confirm whether this is happening to you as well, or it’s an issue from my end (csv file data ambiguity).

Thank you,
Parampreet Singh

posts.name: Bijoy Biju Varghese
posts.cooked: Just try in a different browser and see

Barcelona:100

I too facing the same issue for Q11, Q12 and Q15. It is accepting NaN as a correct answer.

Please help

image1356×173 8.44 KB

posts.name: Saikat Mandal
posts.cooked: Do the boolean modifications in file, you should get the answers.

posts.name: DataScience
posts.cooked: I did that, but how NaN is considered as a correct answer.

posts.name: Carlton D'Silva
posts.cooked:
Hi DataScience,

Its because the validation is done on the data in your file. If your files you uploaded contain values that are not according to the spec then the Check Answers script will give you wrong results. (Garbage in = Garbage out)

Kind regards

posts.name: DataScience
posts.cooked:
Noted. Thanks.

What misled is the below statement where it is mentioned to use true and false for boolean. However, for analysis purpose, I made changes to the local copy as 1 for true and 0 for false. But I didn’t add it in my repository.
Since time has already crossed, i can’t submit anymore. but i will try to see whether the above works.

Regards
